value.name: Check Shodan Host IP
value.description:
Returns all services that have been found on the given host IP.
What does Shodan say about IP address 8.8.8.8?
value.descriptionForModel:
Returns all services that have been found on the given host IP.
What does Shodan say about IP address 8.8.8.8?
examplePrompts: Check IP Address 8.8.8.8 using Shodan
Use Shodan to check IP address  8.8.8.8

inputs.name: history
inputs.description: True if all historical banners should be returned (default: False).

inputs.name: minify
inputs.description: True to only return the list of ports and the general host information, no banners. (default: False).

settings.QueryInputs:minify:Type:Name: Boolean
settings.QueryInputs:minify:Name: minify
settings.QueryInputs:minify:Description: True to only return the list of ports and the general host information, no banners. (default: False).

settings.QueryInputs:history:Description: True if all historical banners should be returned (default: False).

settings.PathInputs:ip:Name: ip

value.name: Get Shodan Host Count
value.description: This method behaves identical to "/shodan/host/search" with the only difference that this method does not return any host results, it only returns the total number of results that matched the query and any facet information that was requested. As a result this method does not consume query credits.
value.descriptionForModel: This method behaves identical to "/shodan/host/search" with the only difference that this method does not return any host results, it only returns the total number of results that matched the query and any facet information that was requested. As a result this method does not consume query credits.
examplePrompts: What does Shodan know about the host count for port:22?
Use Shodan to look up the host count for port:22

inputs.name: query
inputs.description: Shodan search query. The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan, with the additional option to provide filters inside the search query using a "filter:value" format. For example, the following search query would find Apache Web servers located in Germany: "apache country:DE". [List of Filters](https://www.shodan.io/search/filters)

inputs.name: facets
inputs.description: A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on. Property names can also be in the format of "property:count", where "count" is the number of facets that will be returned for a property (i.e. "country:100" to get the top 100 countries for a search query). Visit the Shodan website's Facet Analysis page for an up-to-date list of available facets: [Explore Facets](https://beta.shodan.io/search/facet)

settings.QueryInputs:query:Type:Name: String
settings.QueryInputs:query:Name: query
settings.QueryInputs:query:Description: Shodan search query. For example, the following search query would find Apache Web servers located in Germany: "apache country:DE". [List of Filters](https://www.shodan.io/search/filters)
settings.QueryInputs:facets:Type:Name: String
settings.QueryInputs:facets:Name: facets
settings.QueryInputs:facets:Description: A comma-separated list of properties to get summary information on. Property names can also be in the format of "property:count", where "count" is the number of facets that will be returned for a property (i.e. "country:100" to get the top 100 countries for a search query). Visit the Shodan website's Facet Analysis page for an up-to-date list of available facets: [Explore Facets](https://beta.shodan.io/search/facet)

value.name: Get Shodan Host Search
value.description:
Search Shodan using the same query syntax as the website and use facets to get summary information for different properties.

## **Requirements**

This method may use API query credits depending on usage. If any of the following criteria are met, your account will be deducted 1 query credit:

1. The search query contains a filter.
2. Accessing results past the 1st page using the "page". For every 100 results past the 1st page 1 query credit is deducted.
value.descriptionForModel:
Search Shodan using the same query syntax as the website and use facets to get summary information for different properties.

## **Requirements**

This method may use API query credits depending on usage. If any of the following criteria are met, your account will be deducted 1 query credit:

1. The search query contains a filter.
2. Accessing results past the 1st page using the "page". For every 100 results past the 1st page 1 query credit is deducted.
examplePrompts: Search for hosts running port:22 using Shodan.
Use Shodan to look up the hosts running port:22

The provided string is used to search the database of banners in Shodan, with the additional option to provide filters inside the search query using a "filter:value" format. For example, the following search query would find Apache Web servers located in Germany: "apache country:DE".

Visit the Shodan website's Facet Analysis page for an up-to-date list of available facets:

value.name: Get Shodan Host Search Facets
value.description: This method returns a list of facets that can be used to get a breakdown of the top values for a property.
value.descriptionForModel: This method returns a list of facets that can be used to get a breakdown of the top values for a property.

What are all the Shodan search facets?

value.name: Get Shodan Host Search Tokens
value.description: This method lets you determine which filters are being used by the query string and what parameters were provided to the filters.

examplePrompts: Use Shodan to break down Raspbian port:22 into tokens.

value.name: Get Shodan Protocols
value.description: This method returns an object containing all the protocols that can be used when launching an Internet scan.

value.name: Get Shodan Scans
value.description: Returns a listing of all the on-demand scans that are currently active on the account.
value.descriptionForModel: Returns a listing of all the on-demand scans that are currently active on the account.
examplePrompts: Get list of all the created scans via Shodan.
What are all the scans created by Shodan?

value.name: Get Shodan Scan ID
value.description:
Check the progress of a previously submitted scan request. Possible values for the status are:

- SUBMITTING
- QUEUE
- PROCESSING
- DONE
value.descriptionForModel:
Check the progress of a previously submitted scan request. Possible values for the status are:

- SUBMITTING
- QUEUE
- PROCESSING
- DONE
examplePrompts: Get the status of the scan request DQdcm6QYgENbGj0R using Shodan.
What does Shodan say about the scan request DQdcm6QYgENbGj0R?

inputs.name: id
inputs.description: The unique scan ID that was returned by /shodan/scan.
